questions.question: Which of the following is a valid C identifier?
Which of the following is used to create a pointer to an integer?
Which of the following operators has the highest precedence in C?
Which of the following functions is used to dynamically allocate memory in C?
Which of the following is true for the 'sizeof' operator?
options: It returns the number of bytes taken by a variable or data type
It returns the size of the pointer in bytes
It is used to allocate memory
It can be used to determine the length of an array
questions.answer: It returns the number of bytes taken by a variable or data type

questions.question: Which of the following correctly declares a structure in C?
options: struct point { int x; int y; };
struct { int x; int y; } point;
int struct point { int x; int y; };
structure point { int x; int y; };
questions.answer: struct point { int x; int y; };

questions.question: How do you declare an array of 10 integers in C?
Which of the following statements is true about recursion in C?
options: A recursive function can call itself indefinitely without any issue
A recursive function must have a base case to terminate
Recursion is always faster than iteration
questions.answer: A recursive function must have a base case to terminate

questions.question: Which of the following is used to access the elements of a pointer array?
Which of the following statements is true about C's preprocessor directives?
options: #include is used to include library files
#ifdef checks if a macro is defined

questions.question: Which of the following statements about pointers is correct?
options: Pointers store the memory address of variables
Pointers cannot be used with arrays
Pointers do not support arithmetic operations
Pointers can be incremented by adding 1 to the pointer
questions.answer: Pointers store the memory address of variables

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'break' statement in C?
options: To continue to the next iteration

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about the 'void' keyword in C?
options: It indicates a function that returns no value
It can be used to declare a pointer to a type-less entity
It can be used in a function to take no arguments

questions.question: Which of the following is not a storage class in C?
Which of the following is true about an array in C?
options: It is a collection of variables of different types
It is a collection of variables of the same type
It is a collection of functions
questions.answer: It is a collection of variables of the same type

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct?
options: sizeof(int) can vary depending on the system
questions.answer: sizeof(int) can vary depending on the system

questions.question: Which of the following correctly checks if a number is odd in C?
